pr_title: GEODE-7652: MembershipBuilder lets you set the local locator

timeline.bodyText: removing this method was important! see MembershipBuilder.setMembershipLocator()
timeline.author: Bill
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -32,13 +32,6 @@
   void start(
       final ID memberID);
 
-  /**
-   * Invoked when the Membership is starting. All membership services will have been
-   * initialized and had their "started" methods invoked but we will not yet have joined
-   * the cluster.
-   */
-  void started();
-

timeline.bodyText: this method on the builder is the replacement for the eliminated started() method on LifecycleListener
timeline.author: Bill

timeline.bodyText: important addition here: if a membership locator was specified, then tell the services about it
timeline.author: Bill

replies.bodyText: When would there not be a membershipLocator specified?
replies.author: echobravopapa

replies.bodyText: when running in a regular member that is not a locator
replies.author: Bill

timeline.bodyText: This logic here replaces what used to be implemented by callers in their LifecycleListener.started() (overridden) methods. Nice thing about this is it's implemented in one place so clients of the membership subsystem can't screw it up
timeline.author: Bill

timeline.bodyText:
what was a setLocator() method is now a setLocators() one. do you hate me for this?
by way of justification, these two objects are 1-1 in the design. I think it's a Good Thing™ that there are two (smaller) interfaces instead of one (bigger one)
timeline.author: Bill

replies.bodyText: William, I like the positively pre-emptive persuasion here... at first glance I was certainly questioning this methods signature...
replies.author: echobravopapa

timeline.bodyText: This method had and has important initialization logic (see new block comment above). This is the code that needs to be invoked after services are _start_ed but before the distributed system is joined.
timeline.author: Bill

timeline.bodyText: Reviewers: I'm looking for your critique of this exception. If somebody passed in a locator, and also specified config parameters to cause this routine to start a locator, it seems to me we want to stop and inform them of the conflict.
timeline.author: Bill

replies.bodyText:
I'm not sure I would describe this as an "Internal error" since it seems like it results from a user's misconfiguration?
Could we be more specific here - like "Setting the start-locator property is not supported in dedicated locators launched through gfsh or the Java Locator class?"
replies.author: upthewaterspout

timeline.bodyText: completely aside... is this a TODO for an old bug or what follows was the fix for it? anyone, bueller...
timeline.author: echobravopapa

replies.bodyText: my impression when I see a comment like that is that it denotes a fix for that bug—not a TODO
replies.author: Bill

replies.bodyText:
On your other comment, re: when would there not be a membershipLocator specified (to MembershipBuilderImpl?)
I'd say when building membership in a JVM that is not a locator—it's just a member.
replies.author: Bill
